intro: Gynandropsis jamesonii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water storage. Gynandropsis jamesonii is also known for its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
